children.text: Late December is all about game of the year this and best AAA game that, but what about all of the games that tend to fly under the radar? But what about the small indie games that small teams pour years of their hard work and endless passion into? This article is here to highlight those hidden gems on Nintendo Switch that released in the last 12 months.
Disclaimer: All ratings are noted in the ESRB rating.

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/A-jIc_Yz7RE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Absolute Drift - Switch Release Trailer

children.text: This self proclaimed zen game is something really special and presents a welcome challenge. Get ready for precise driving and lots of crashing/practice in this arcade style driving game focused entirely on the automotive art of drifting. It breaks the mold of most driving games and what you wind up with is a game that's fun and challenging but never feels unfair or overly technical. The simplicity is where it really shines: the controls, graphics and concept are all bare bones and better off for it.
Click here to read our review of Absolute Drift

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/v4A1dl_CD7Y?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Aeolis Tournament - Release Trailer

children.text: Charge up your air cannon and get ready to blast your opponents away in up to eight player multiplayer mayhem. In this action party game,

has you competing in a variety of different modes with nothing but your air cannon and some determination. Its simple one button mechanic makes it accessible for players of all skill levels whilst not relying on luck and its mode variety keeps the gameplay fresh.
Click here to read our review of Aeolis Tournament

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ghMdj8Y500M?start=12&feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Alwa's Legacy Switch Trailer

children.text: , both developed by the awesome peeps at Elden Pixels. the story follows the protagonist Zoe as she meanders her way through the world of Alwa. It’s an action adventure/Metroidvania faithful to the games in the genre from the 80’s and 90’s and is sure to tap into the conscience of gaming nostalgia fans.
Click here to read our review of Alwa's Legacy

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/t4exZAEBLT4?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Arcade Spirits - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: In a world full of neon lights and the love of video games all around you,

has you starting a brand new job at Funplex, the local arcade with a colourful cast of staff. Delve on a path to better yourself and perhaps find that special someone along the way. If you’ve ever wanted to work in an arcade or you just want to play a game that sparks joy, then this is the game for you.
Click here to read our review of Arcade Spirits

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/R6PXlvEtNKc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Boomerang Fu - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: Quaint with a childish charm and a competitive spin that makes for one of the Switch’s best party games,

is an instant classic with its quirky physics, stunning visuals, upbeat music, and wealth of replay value. It’s cute, slick, and incredibly unique. There’s nothing quite like it on the market right now and yet the niche it fulfills feels oddly necessary.
Click here to read our review of Boomerang Fu

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0eeDFxsx1ZQ?start=10&feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Brief Battles - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: has you and up to three friends obtaining special underpants abilities in order to take each other out in an arena-style brawler. Juicy Cupcake’s debut title
is a satirical gold mine that brings a lot of wit and charm to the party arena-based fighting genre.
Click here to read our review of Brief Battles

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OR8CjIYwmxM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Carto - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: After Carto is flung from her granny’s aircraft during a vicious storm, she finds herself with naught but her wit and a unique ability that allows her to alter the world like pieces in a multi-fitting jigsaw puzzle. Along the way, Carto will travel from one mysterious land to the next, helping villagers solve their problems and doing what she can to get back to her granny.
is a unique masterpiece that is the epitome of charm.
Click here to read our review of Carto

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HqxYc-E8rhg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Embracelet - Release Date Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: Before the death of Jesper’s grandfather, he shares secrets of his past, passes down a mysterious bracelet and reveals that a young 17 year old Jesper will find answers on the northern Norwegian island known as Slepp.

is a narrative driven adventure game about loss and magic. It adopts many traits of the point and click genre whilst throwing in a twist to be able to shift large objects with the power of the magic bracelet.
Click here to read our review of Embracelet

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/N75AYS6VNW8?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Fledgling Heroes - Nintendo Switch Launch Trailer (EU/AU/NZ)

children.text: Dodge, duck, dip, dive and dodge through over 90 flapping levels as you control six different birds on a mystical adventure.
is Subtle Boom’s debut title and it proves that the team certainly have a lot of talent and a bright future ahead of them.
Click here to read our review Fledgling Heroes

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8RY_JkKLnbc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Guard Duty - Launch Trailer

children.text: is a tale as old as time itself; the beautiful princess has been kidnapped and it’s up to Tondbert, the lowly guard, to rise above adversity, find the evil that plagues the land, undo the wrong decision that altered the course of humanity and sets to destroys civilisation as we know it almost one thousand years in the future and, wait… What were we doing again? Oh right, the princess! Inspired by classics of the genre,
is a point and click adventure that takes you on a journey, spanning a millennium whilst not forgetting to have a laugh along the way.
Click here to read our review of Guard Duty

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VDSRK3XvO5o?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Heroes of Hammerwatch - Ultimate Edition Trailer | Nintendo Switch XBOX One | Online Co-Op Roguelite

children.text: is a procedurally-generated dungeon crawler, having you battle hordes of enemies as you work your way to the very top of the Forsaken Spire. Go in, grab all the loot you can find and make sure to bring it back up to the surface before you die because in the mines, your gold will be lost forever.
Click here to read our Quick Review of Heroes of Hammerwatch: Ultimate Edition

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zpGK0Dq45vQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: HyperParasite | Gameplay Trailer | Nintendo Switch

children.text: An evil parasite is slithering around a dystopian 80s, controlling civilians’ host bodies and wreaking havoc. As a roguelite twin-stick shooter, you play as said parasite, with various body types to take over and each with their own unique stats and abilities. So let’s conquer the world, one body at a time. It’s a roguelite done right in every sense of the word and is one that deserves every recognition it gets and then some.
Click here to read our review of HyperParasite

metadata.title: Infliction: Extended Cut - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: With a rocky introduction reminiscent of YouTube’s golden days of let’s players delving into cheap horror video-games with exaggerated ahs and oohs,

sets the stage for a rocky but charming experience. However, it goes above and beyond that first impression. It benefits from a captivating story, a lack of reliance on jump-scares, and its responsive technical prowess.
Click here to read our review of Infliction: Extended Cut

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PaDoFWP4zUc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: ITTA is Available Now on Nintendo Switch

children.text: ​ is really weird, complete with ghost cats, chaotic gameplay and a chilling story. This game

s​eems to draw clear inspiration from a varied group of games from the past 20 years. It​ is the distilled essence of what makes a good indie game with clear influence from both the indie community and more mainstream sources.
Click here to read our review of ITTA

metadata.title: KUNAI - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: is set in a post-apocalypic alternate future where robots are the sole lifeform due to a catastrophic event caused by the evil artificial intelligence known as Lemonkus. You play as Tabby, a sentient tablet with the spirit of an ancient warrior, as you delve into the depths of Earth’s ruins to uncover ancient weapons and face Lemonkus face-to-face. With its minimalistic art style and slick control movements, Kunai will have you feeling like a real robot ninja.
Click here to read our review of KUNAI
Legends of Amberland: The Forgotten Crown

metadata.title: Legends of Amberland: The Forgotten Crown - Nintendo Switch - Launch Trailer

children.text: Legends of Amberland: The Forgotten Crown

takes direct inspiration from classic CRPGs from the early 90s, where movement was grid based and characters were shown only in small portraits. It embraces the history of the genre they are paying homage to while adding some quality of life mechanics, such as an onscreen map that helps to make the experience easier.
Click here to read our Quick Review of Legends of Amberland: The Forgotten Crown

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4jEwwU1kQr0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: 🚂Locomotion🚂 - Coming to Nintendo Switch on July 30th

children.text: All aboard a puzzle adventure along the railroad tracks, collecting lost gold and proceeding from one crazy world to the next.
‘s family-friendly approach is an invitation to players of all ages. With a total of 52 bite-sized levels to enjoy across four unique worlds,
is perhaps a perfect puzzle game to experience on Switch.
Click here to read our review of Locomotion

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sx5NcADMca8?start=95&feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Nine Witches: Family Disruption - Available Now!

children.text: The month is October 1944 at the height of the second World War. In a Nazi occupied Norwegian town of Sundäe, the Okkulte-55 is on a mission to put an end to the war by unleashing an ancient curse. Alexei Krakovitz, a quadriplegic professor with the ability to communicate with the dead, and Akiro Kagasawa, Alexei’s faithful assistant from Japan, are on a mission to put a stop to the Nazi’s evil plans by going undercover in classic adventure style. With dry dark humour that’ll sure to have you smiling from ear-to-ear with slight pangs of guilt as shiny red cherries on top, there's a reason
won the award of Best Hidden Gem, as well as being nominated for Best Nindie, in our
Click here to read our review of Nine Witches: Family Disruption
Oceanhorn 2: Knights of the Lost Realm

children.text: Oceanhorn 2: Knights of the Lost Realm
was one of our five nominations for Best Hidden Gem. The game is an homage to the
series and plays very similarly i.e. action RPGs with a heavy emphasis on exploration and puzzle solving. It’s well-made and fun, a must-have for any
Click here to read our review of Oceanhorn 2: Knights of the Lost Realm

metadata.title: Projection: First Light - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: Enter the world of shadow puppeteering as a young girl named Greta who can manipulate light to travel to far off lands. In

, experience a variety of cultures and embrace their artistic approaches to the practise as the mischievous Greta chases a butterfly into a Shadow Theatre where her world takes many new forms before her very eyes. We at Switchaboo had been looking forward to
interviewed Michael from Shadowplay Studios back at PAX AUS 2018
and it was well worth the wait.
Click here to read our review of Projection: First Light
Red Wings: Aces of the Sky

metadata.title: Red Wings: Aces of the Sky | Official Nintendo Switch Release Trailer | 2020

children.text: Games set in historical times tend to get bogged down in their setting that’ll alienate some players. Luckily,
is a fast paced WWI-era dogfighting game that doesn’t take itself too seriously.
is something special and this is due in great part to the restraint of the studio.
Click here to read our review of Red Wings: Aces of the Sky

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/eox0kHT6R0o?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Sky Racket - Launch Trailer - Nintendo Switch

children.text: This slept-on indie gem is tucked away in an oasis of its own making, standing out from the desert of retro Indies and solidifying itself as an instant classic.
has a name as catchy as
and so much polish that it’s not even remotely surprising that this game has been in development for half a decade.
Click here to read our review of Sky Racket

metadata.title: Spacejacked - Launch Trailer

children.text: is a 2D tower defence game that also borrows elements from 2D run ‘n gun platformers. Build and upgrade turrets, defend the Core against them and protect the spaceship to make it out alive. You’re the only one who can save the ship and rescue the kidnapped crew, so let’s show these aliens what we’re made of!
Click here to read our review of Spacejacked

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YHKsbvG7J3A?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: Super Squidlit Nintendo Switch trailer

children.text: Relive the glory days of gaming with Squidlit, a charming platforming adventure that is faithful to the Game Boy hardware. In Squidlit, evil is afoot, and your little squid friend must jump, ink enemies and eat muffins to save the land. Stop the villainous Skwit Skwot in all of Squidlit’s puke-green goodness.
Click here to read our review of Squidlit

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7dr9EtY4ggo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: TAURONOS | Official Switch Trailer

children.text: Locked in a labyrinth where the goal is to escape, you are trapped with a vicious Minotaur who lives within and is constantly hunting you down with unending vigor.

is a well designed adventure influenced by Greek mythology that will have you wanting to escape the puzzles that trap you. Delve deeper into your own memories and pray to the gods that you escape and kill the beast.
Click here to read our review of TAURONOS

children.html: <iframe width="356" height="200" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QLcIYxyGjiM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

metadata.title: WARBORN | Out Now on Switch, Steam, PS4 & XboxOne

children.text: set in space, and that’s not a bad thing. It takes the fun head-scratching combat that makes the genre great and takes away the extraneous fluff like an arbitrary overworld and overly complicated story. Things like this may add to the complexity of a game, but they don’t always add to the enjoyment.
strips that away and keeps the bones intact.
Click here to read our review of WARBORN

metadata.title: Wingspan - Nintendo Switch Launch Trailer

children.text: Card Game / Board Game / Strategy / Party
Snuggle up with your switch and a nice cup of hot cocoa and a blanket overtop this holiday season with

you won't regret it one bit. For all intents and purposes, this bird-themed board game makes the leap from coffee table to small screen in spectacular fashion - it's infectiously cute in all the right places, and is intuitive to a T. If there's a card game to get on the Switch, or a board game for that matter, then
Click here to read our review of WINGSPAN
